properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 917, 2ND FL APARTMENT WITHOUT A CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 4TH FLOOR CORRIDOR NO SMOKE DETECTORS, ALSO AT 3,2,1, LL, LAUNDRY ROOM.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: LAUNDRY ROOM NO CO DETECTOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: LAUNDRY ROOM AND 843 W. BARRY APT. 2ND FLOOR NORTH CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: BASEMENT LAUNDRY ROOM MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: TOP OF SOUTHEAST STAIRWAY-MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: SOUTH BASEMENT LAUNDRY ROOM -MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: SOUTH EAST PORCH.  6X6 COLUMN SEATED ON STONE BLOCK WHICH IN TURN IS SEATED ON CONCRETE.  BLOCK AND COLUMN NOT SECURE.  BEAM SEPARATING FROM COLUMN AT 2.  SINGLE 2X8 BEAMS SPAN 7' 5" AND SUPPORT STRINGER HEADER BEAMS.  JOIST HANGERS MISSING FASTENERS.  CENTRAL 4X4 STRINGER COLUMNS AND COLUMNS FOR HEADERS EXTEND OVER 24'.  RISERS AT WINDER TREADS DO NOT EXTEND DOWN TO BOTTOM OF BACK OF TREADS, RESULTING IN INSUFFICIENT NAILING SURFACE AND CONNECTIONS  THROUGH RISERS TO SUPPORT TREADS AT WEDGES AND JOINTS.  THIS CONDITION IS REAPEATED AT ALL WINDER TREADS FOR ALL PORCHES.  SOUTH EAST PORCH CONTINUED- 4X4 LAPP JOINT SPLICE WITH UP TO 1/4" GAPS.  RAIL CAPS 2X6 LOOSE AND SEPARATING.  HEADERS AND BEAMS NOT ANCHORED WITH THROUGH BOLTS OR HANGES.  LOOSE TREADS, LOOSE AND DEFLECTING RAILS.  POSTS FACE MOUNTED AND ANCHORED WITH NAILS AND 1 LAG BOLT ONLY.  EAST CENTER PORCH- 6X6 COLUMNS ON SLAB WITH SHIMS USED TO LEVEL SERVICE UNDERNEATH.  SEVERAL STRINGER TO OTHER WOOD MEMBER CONNECTIONS MADE WITHN NAILS ONLY.  4X4 STRINGER COLUMNS ARE NOTCHED FOR 2X MATERIAL AND EXTEND OVER 24'.  2X8 JOISTS WITH 18" ON CENTER SPAN 12'.  SINGEL 2X8 STRINGER HEADERS.  WINDER CONDITIONS ARE AS NOTED ON SOUTH EAST PORCH.  TREAD AND RAIL NAILS POPPING THROUGHOUT.  GUARD RAIL SPANS UP TO 8'8" WITH NO CENTRAL SUPPORT.  NORTH EAST PORCH WITH FALSE, FRACTURED FOOTING.  2X8 JOISTS AT 18" CENTERS SPAN 10' 4".  SINGLE STRINGER HEADER JOISTS.  STRINGER AND POSTS ANCHORED WITH SIMPSON CORNER TIES AND NAILS ONLY.  POSTS AND STRINGERS NOT BOLTED.  BEAMS ANCHORED TO JOISTS/ HEADERS WITH SIMPSON CORNER TIES AND NAILS ONLY.  BEAM AT 2 IS MASONRY POCKET WHERE BRICK IS FRACTURED AND LOOSE, NO MASONRY ANCHOR.  6X6 LAPP JOINT SPLICE WITH GAPS UP TO 1/4" AT MIDDLE AND BOTTOM.  STRINGERS SEPARATING FROM COLUMN CONNECTIONS.  WINDER CONDITIONS ARE AS NOTED ON SOUTH EAST PORCH.  FRACTURED TREAD BETWEEN 2 AND 3.  AREAS OF ROTT AT BEAMS AND JOISTS.  ROTTING AND BUCKLING DECK AT 3.  GUARD RAIL CAPS LOOSE AND SEPARATING AS NOTED ON PREVIOUS PORCHES.  RAIL AT 3 SPANS 7' WITH ONLY CENTRAL SUPPORT BEING A TOE NAILED PICKET.  LOOSE TREADS.  4X4 STRINGER COLUMN SPANS OVER 24' AND IS ALSO SEATED ON SLAB.  ALL WEST PORCHES WITH SIMILAR DEFECTS AS WELL AS MORE SEVERE CONDITIONS SUCH AS WEST CENTRAL PORCH WITH INNER 4X4 COLUMNS SUPPORTED BY 1RST LEVELS STRINGER HEADER/ JOIST.  THESE JOISTS ARE 2X8 AND SPAN APPROX. 12'.  THESE INNER 4X4'S DO NOT EXTEND TO GROUND BUT ARE SUSPENDED BY FIRST LEVELS JOIST AND THESE 4X4 COLUMNS THEN EXTEND UP AND CARRY HALF OF THE STRINGER LOAD UP TO THE 3RD FLOOR EACH TIME BEING ANCHORED WO THE UNDERSIZED/ OVER SPANNED 2X8 STRINGER HEADER/ JOIST.  OUTSIDE 4X4 STRINGER COLUMNS ARE OUT OF PLUMB WITH BOWING OCCURING AT LAPP JOINT, THESE ALSO EXTEND OVER 24'.  OBTAIN COMPLETE PLAN AND PERMIT FOR ALL PORCHES.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2900N - GARDEN APARTMENT - CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2900N GARDEN APARTMENT - SMOKE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 948A - SMOKE DETECTOR MISSING
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 948A UNIT MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR RESALE SHOP MISSING SMOKE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR RESALE SHOP MISSING SMOKE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.
